website_summaries.verdict: At 2 pounds and only 6 inches, this lightweight pocket drill-driver from Bosch can be used without fear of hand fatigue.
pros: The brushless motor can extend the life of your drill up to two times
It features a 3/8-inch chuck and an LED work light, and you can store 4 bits directly on the tool
This bundle comes with the drill, 2 batteries, a charger, and a soft carry bag
cons: Because of the unit's compact size, the battery is housed in the handle, which can make it awkward to hold for individuals with smaller hands

customer_reviews.title: Case is misrepresented in photos
customer_reviews.text: Case for GSR12V-300B22 has no rubber handle grip, or patch logo. Logo is embroidered directly on the front surface (which is admittedly just a cosmetic downgrade), and the handle is just bare webbing. I wonder if the generation one (PS32) also had a downgraded case. I bought this and the equivalent Milwaukee, and plan to see which I like more, but the cheapness of the Bosch kit lost it points already. They've already downgraded from hard cases (can't even find a hard case to buy separately), and now they're working to make the soft case even cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Taverner

customer_reviews.title: difficult battery removal
customer_reviews.text: This item is compact, easy to handle and lightweight, just what I need for light jobs around the house. I am 80, a woman, and when I tried to get the battery out it was IMPOSSIBLE! I had my husband try it--no luck--and a workman came by and i had him try it and after repeated tries, it did come out, but I never was able to do it. I am sorry, as it seemed just the ticket for my uses. I returned the item and will go to a box store where I can try the battery removal before bringing it home!
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: This small drill is a powerhouse!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best cordless drill I have ever owned & that's at least five over the past 25 years. It's not the super-heavy type with the big "butt-type" battery that's a hassle to carry around & store. It has an amazing bright light that comes on the second the trigger is pulled & the overall power is all you need around the house or in a garage workshop. It has plenty of torque to fasten any type screw or anchor & many settings for drilling. The carry case is very ample with numerous compartments for the extra batter, charger & drill accessories you may have.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill and very durable!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just great as a compact driver. It's really small for the power. The quick release chuck is handy, as well as the torque adjustment. The battery seems to last forever, I've been using it to renovate my house for weeks and it isn't even below 2/3 bars. If I had to list downsides I would say the drilling power isn't great - you're going to need at least an 18V drill to drill lots of holes in wood or drill into metal. UPDATE: I've been using it for a while and dropped it from a 6' ladder onto concrete a couple of times. Still works, no cracks or anything. Good drill.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build and ergonomics, great performance.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding build, great power to weight ratio, well implemented grip rubber. The LED light is slightly off target at. Much quieter operation. Included several bits in kit box. Perfect for hobby/home use, small footprint allows use it tight spots. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: THis replaces a cheap Harbor Freight cordless drill I had. IT's so much nicer, more powerful and handles better. I have used it many times and am glad to have bought it. It doesn't get heavy duty use. I have had to drill into studs for mounting things, and it is great. Haven't tried it for steel or concrete, but haven't had the need either. I really like that it comes with two batteries so I never have to worry about it not having enough juice to get the job done. I plan on getting other tools in the same line that use the same battery cells. Bosch always has delivered for me.
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy a DeWalt, but after asking my old man, who's still a tool-junkie at 90, I decided to go with Bosch. I needed to install some tin on an old barn and wanted a lighter drill/driver for the tin screws. UPS delivered it around 4PM and I had tin up and 300 screws done and dusted by 5:30 on the charge the battery came with. Best tool I own, except for the others I need as and when. Best drill I own, though, that's for sure. It's small but packs a punch. And the light, handle-insert batteries charge real quick. Buy one. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Limey Smokejumper

customer_reviews.title: Already broken
customer_reviews.text: Light duty around the house. Purchased in 2017. Already broken(will not reverse) and out of warranty. Pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. K

customer_reviews.title: Compact but a bit loud
customer_reviews.text: Like the compact size. But for a brushless motor I would expect it to be quieter. The drill seems louder than a brushed motor which is not necessarily surprising because if they are using a conventional trapezoidal drive brushless motors can actually be louder than brushed. However if the switched to a sinusoidal (aka FOC) drive the motor would make a lot less noise. Bosch: what do you say?
customer_reviews.author: Ilan S.

customer_reviews.title: Love this little drill!
customer_reviews.text: Really like how compact this thing is. The battery also lasts quite a while. Two gripes, one minor the other medium: 1. The charger design makes it a little difficult to insert the battery properly...takes a little fiddling and close attention to get it locked in. Will probably get better with practice. 2. Like most keyless chucks, the one on this drill will loosen up under use, especially when removing screws. This one seems worse than most, probably because a 12v tool has less power in the first place for tightening. If not for that tool would be 5 star. Still super handy and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Old Sneelock

customer_reviews.title: Great drill, lightweight, lots of power, good battery life
customer_reviews.text: This drill is smaller than many other 12V lithium drills, and it's really easy to hold in the hand comfortably. Torque settings actually work, compared to older cordless drills I've used in the past - correct torque makes a huge difference when drilling or driving screws. I strip way fewer screw heads with this drill. The battery life is great for what I do, and it charges pretty quickly for my needs. My only gripe is that the work light above the trigger is very dim, but it's serviceable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Charger unit is cheap and Awkward
customer_reviews.text: If you are used to a larger drill, you are in for a shock. The thing is smaller than you think. That batteries are tiny. The Charging unit and batteries seem like children's toys. However once you get past all that, it does work great as advertised. Your manhood might be a little damaged but you will be ok. The cheap charging unit however needs to go!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Like everything about it!!  A great tool to have.
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect! Powerful yet lightweight, easily fits in tight places. The batteries hold a single charge for a long time, and with the two batteries this beauty has you will never run out of juice. The only thing I got burned on was the additional bits I’d bought. Heads up! They’re not all that great unfortunately. Bought a couple of small sets that were worthless so do be careful. Otherwise I am really impressed and happy with my buy - feels good to own it 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: icus

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable to power brushes ???
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be adaptable to power brushes....still can’t figure out if it is!! ?? I bought it to use cleaning metal, etc and also as a power drill......but did I buy the wrong one?
customer_reviews.author: Margie A Melton

customer_reviews.title: Wow...the precision of this lightweight drill is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Bosch batteries are known for their quality. I put a retired Bosch impact driver (7 years without much use) back into service and the batteries are still good! This was purchased to compliment the impact driver for a grab and go kit for small jobs. The precision of the variable speeds using the trigger is excellent. It has a lot of torque for it's size as well. The only downside is (and it is very minor) is that the bit does not stay in the bit holder that came with the drill very well. Not a big deal just use another bit holder with a better magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Baker

customer_reviews.title: Man this is brilliant
customer_reviews.text: If this isn't one of the finest power tools ever made, I don't know what is. Just look at what you're getting, a couple hundred precision engineered parts, perfectly realized into existence, and assembled into a work of art. It is stunning that this was less that $100. If you showed this to the Wright Brothers, they would cry. And the perfection of the variable speed trigger is the real winner. No surging. No half crazed Dewalt 18v banshee. No. This is a craftsman tool for an artist, the Story Musgraves of this world.
customer_reviews.author: nibbles

customer_reviews.title: Great compact drill
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great little compact cordless drill. It makes a great secondary drill to have for predrilling holes in various woodworking projects where I use a larger cordless for driving the actual fasteners. Not that this drill cant handle fasteners because its quite powerful with a very nice clutch but its great to have on hand so your not always switching bits etc. Needless to say its small size make it very well suited for tight spaces where larger drills wont fit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: Died from light use
customer_reviews.text: I've used it maybe a dozen times, and last night I was hanging up some new blinds. There was wood framing around the window well so I pre-drilled all the holes to an appropriate diameter for the screws. The first ten screws were fine, number eleven, it died. Drill turns but some internal gear starts grinding and it doesn't turn with any resistance. I was able to use a screwdriver no problem. Something internal is cheaply made, going to need to find something more robust. I hate having all this wasted material, let alone the cost of said junk.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Perdect to include in the diy'r tool aresrnal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband for Christmas here's what he said.....works as a great substitute for his 18 volt ryobi. So light and can drive 3 inch screws without an issue. Battery life is as longer than expected. Can almost go a whole day on one charge with moderate use. The led light comes In handy, not the brightest, but with a light press of the trigger the led will come on without starting the motor. After a long day his hands aren't nearly as fatigued as when using the other screwguns.
customer_reviews.author: Smckenzie802

customer_reviews.title: Many years ago I got my first cordless drill. ...
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago I got my first cordless drill. My husband (now ex) bought it for me and I was almost insulted. It did not have the power I wanted. Now I am older and not as strong, so I figured I'd have to compromise by buying a lighter tool and having less power. I was pleasantly surprised. This baby can do the job. This is no electric screwdriver masquerading as a drill. The battery actually holds a charge and there is the extra battery, so if one runs out you can switch it out and continue rather than wait hours to finish the project. This is a tool for real projects but light enough for dabblers.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Vons

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life and lots of torque for such a small tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a small job ace. Perfect for 99% of around the house jobs. The batteries last a very long time and I have not had any problem with torque. I like the locking feature, basically stop pressing the trigger and it can be used like a giant screwdriver. The light also stays on for a second after trigger release which is nice and the led placement throws good illumination. The included bit holder cracked already, but it isn’t a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: N. W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill/driver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the strength of a Consumer Reports review. It's even better than the review. My first job was sinking about 50 #10 x 1" sheet metal screws through some heavy plastic into damp wood. It's small, easy to handle, fits my hand perfectly and after the job the indicator on the drill showed the battery was still at or near full charge. I'm a professional woodworker (shipwright) and this is going to be my portable drill/driver of choice.
customer_reviews.author: WC7P

customer_reviews.title: Batteries charge quickly, great for charging one while working with the other.
customer_reviews.text: The batteries on this drill charge really quickly, which is great for starting a project the same day as receiving the drill in the mail. I have already used this to drill a hole into a piece of wood using a spade bit, and also installed some screws into the side of my house. Both tasks were done with absolutely no problem, unlike my old drill that this was replacing. The instructions were easy to follow, and the hard case is large enough to fit in some extras if needed.
customer_reviews.author: shintojuunana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill!
customer_reviews.text: I am a homeowner and woodworker. Although this is only 12 volts, it has plenty of power for pretty much anything I ever need to do. And it is much smaller and lighter than an 18-volt drill. It is also quieter than most drills. Some drills have a high-pitched shriek, but not this one. The batteries seem to last for a long time. Very glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Happy I got this driver for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I use drivers a lot and have always wanted one with a smaller battery with good ergonomics. With Bosch quality. I love Bosch tools in general and have several. I am the proud owner of this one now. I haven't used it much yet but the times I have show it will be just what I wanted. Highest quality, fit and feel. Easy to use controls. Lots of power. And it came with two batteries and a charger.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Bosch PS32-02 12-volt Brushless 3/8-Inch Portable Drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkable portable drill. It has been some years since I upgraded a portable drill so I am impressed by the small size and comfortable feel of this Bosch PS32-02 12-volt Max Brushless 3/8-Inch portable drill. The brushless motor technology and Lithium Ion battery make a powerful combination. I have been flying brushless motors in my models RC planes for some time and the brushless motors serve extremely well in that capacity. The advent of the powerful magnets has enabled designers to create powerful, light weight, effective products. I recommend this Bosch PS32-02 12 Volt Drill.
customer_reviews.author: handyman

customer_reviews.title: Love This Drill!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur DIY'er with some outdated power tools. When I needed a cordless drill for a massive drywall project, a construction worker told me to go with Bosch. I did. And I love this drill! It comes with a nice carrying case and two batteries. My first battery charge drilled hundreds of screws over a two-week period before it even showed it had used some of the charge. I'm still on the first battery! This drill is powerful enough to penetrate metal and hardwoods. I can't say enough - it's simply a great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Will

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of torque and battery life for numerous repairs around the house.
customer_reviews.text: This little electric screwdriver/drill has been so helpful around the house in a short period of time. I have a use it to repair the chicken coop, Place a diagonal brace in a gate, and various other repairs. It is surprising how long the battery lasts and how much torque there is compared to my old Dewalt NiCad unit. I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Compact Little Beast
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drill that is compact. Definitely fits the bill of quality that Bosch is known for. I have used this drill for about a month now and was immediately surprised by the torque this drill gives for its size. I have done only light projects so far and I think this is mainly suitable for light drilling, but then again I have not been ambitious enough for projects that I feel requires a larger drill; such as installing a guardrail that would require drilling into cement. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Philip So

customer_reviews.title: How do you not include the charger?
customer_reviews.text: The charger was not included in the package. This was brand new. No expedited shipping. I was told standard shipping only. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: chrisp522

customer_reviews.title: must be a "sent to the back" batch
customer_reviews.text: first time I charged batteries it fried the charger. so they replaced it by giving me $$ equal to the cost of the charger. except they didn't add the tax in.. once I got the new charger I found out only one battery still works as well. my guess is this is a batch of "known" defective units.. They're expecting something to fail, so they can then turn and sell you a new charger/battery. For them this is cheaper than opening the packages at factory and reinspecting to find the bad.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I got this drill since I had 5 Ikea dressers as well as a few other furniture items to put together and didn't want to do that by hand with a screwdriver and Allen keys. This drill worked amazingly well and it did not overtighten any of the screws due to the amazing speed control and the torque levels it provides, plus, it is lightweight. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Cavazos

customer_reviews.title: Best Cordless Drill I’ve Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: Best battery power drill I’ve ever had. Its small size allows me to do jobs in small areas which one couldn’t do with a larger drill. Its variable speed can be controlled really precisely. Powerful enough for all my household needs. For this class drill, it was rated #1 by Consumer Reports and that’s how I made my buying decision...and I’m glad I did. Good price, too which I couldn’t find in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kaplowitz

customer_reviews.title: My favorite little drill
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool! Feels good in the hand. Robust construction. Long.....long battery life (for me anyway) and enough torque to get my jobs done. This thing is powerful, yet small enough for nearly any adult's hand. The chuck lock is a great time / aggravation saver! The light, while shadowed a bit by the chuck, is actually helpful and a welcome feature. I can't comment on the variable torque as I haven't yet had any need to use it. Overall this seems a very good tool that is built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Brock

customer_reviews.title: This little guy punches above its weight class
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little "toy" drill specifically to work inside cabinets to drill and set pocket hole screws where a larger drill is cumbersome. I just spent the day hanging drywall which goes behind and above the cabinets and yep I used this "toy" drill. I had to try it out screwing down 3/4" plywood subfloor to joist... yep, did that and actually set the screws flush with the plywood. This drill is truly amazing and if I had to have one drill for 90% of household chores it would be this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell L. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Used-Returning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last week when the price dropped to $85. When I opened the box, the product looked used. There were finger prints on the chuck, the packaging was shoddy with bits loose in the case. I am returning it as I am not paying for used merchandise. Update:Changing to 4 stars because it’s a super product and Amazon did a great job getting me a new replacement. This drill is great.
customer_reviews.author: Android69

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out tool for electronics use.
customer_reviews.text: OK, I LOVE this thing!! First of, I didn't buy this as a drill, but as a screwdriver. I do repairs for a living, so a lightweight in the hand tool is a huge bonus for my arm not falling off at the end of the day. Likes: Battery charge indicator. Ergonomics. A chuck that LOCKS itself, so you can change bits and secure them very easy. BRILLIANT! 2 speed gearbox and a clutch that actually has a light setting. I have yet to need the second battery, but this little drill was definitely worth the price of admission. And... it's still strong enough as a drill. A great tool!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bischoff

customer_reviews.title: You'd be suprised what 12 Volts is capable of!
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time for work around the house and on my car. The only times this thing couldn't finish a job is when the only thing that could was the 3ft breaker bar. Anything short of that and this'll do you just fine! Nothing beats the convenience of clipping a super light weight chordless drill to your belt so you can safely climb a ladder. Just don't forget to drill your pilot holes before using 4 inch wood screws in some oak 2x4's and you'll be good!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Haas

customer_reviews.title: great battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life on this thing is absurdly good. I have had it for 2 months and in that time I have moved to a new house and used this countless times for taking things down, assembling things, drilling into the wall to hang stuff, working around on the garage on ATV's and it still has more than 50% battery life, I can't believe it. It has drilled through everything I have needed it to.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for any household..
customer_reviews.text: I am an average DIY guy and found this drill great. I have it for around a year now and extremely satisfied with the performance and quality. The battery retention is quite good. I am doubling down of my drill usage by investing in cleaning and gardening tools that I can use with the drill.
customer_reviews.author: Neeraj

customer_reviews.title: light weight & powerful
customer_reviews.text: This was rated pretty highly so we thought we would give it a try. WE ARE IMPRESSED! It's as powerful as our full size Makita but much lighter in weight, made a huge difference while we were building our green house. Highly recommend this mighty might drill!
customer_reviews.author: hatescheapproducts

customer_reviews.title: You need "very strong" fingers
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall performance of this tool. It holds the charge for a long time, it is light enough not to be fatiguing, it has sufficient power to drive screws for most household tasks. The huge drawback is the pressure required to squeeze the sides of the battery when trying to remove the battery from the tool. For this reason, I would not recommend purchasing this tool before (as in a trial purchase) you actually try to remove the battery. I think Bosch failed if it thinks this tool would appeal to older people with less strength in their fingers. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Tuckman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid for a little drill.
customer_reviews.text: After using the drill on a couple smaller jobs, I love it. It's small enough that I don't have to think about the weight, yet powerful enough for most anything around the house, be it driving screws or drilling holes. (I have a 20v drill for the big jobs) The first unit I was sent had a problem with the direction switch causing the drill to cease functioning whenever I TOUCHED it (not switched it). Amazon promptly sent out another unit and this one is working great.
customer_reviews.author: BWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is the "perfect" drill/driver for even not-so-light home use. So far the battery stays charged longer than other drills I've had. The driver is much more powerful than a typical "home use" drill/driver. Well made and compact, easy to store drill, charger and bits all in its own soft sided case. Lives up to its rating. I bought one for work where we use it for maintenance jobs and picture framing. Will buy another for home.
customer_reviews.author: NE

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I had waited to buy this and finally pulled the trigger. Light but not as powerful as I had hoped
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great for around the house use
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a massive DeWalt drill for big building projects... but for just about every other project around the house, this one is perfect! Light weight, powerful, versatile. Really happy with this drill
customer_reviews.author: Ragman

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Used on one project so far and it performed very well. Seems as powerful as my old much larger drill. It's a little heaver than I expected after reading the description and reviews but still better than full sized models.
customer_reviews.author: duke77

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light, and capable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in combination with the impact driver. They are both very similar. I like that each of the two packages contained an extra battery. This ensures you will have an adequate charge when you need it. It is easy to use and light
customer_reviews.author: OC

customer_reviews.title: Compact driver that's a must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a good compact driver to put in your tool bag this is it. It has brushless motor plus you can secure and remove a bit without having to engage the motor, then add in the cool belt clip and bit holder that screws onto the back (and yes you can put the bit holder over the belt clip to have both) and this thing is awesome it's got the power I need, it's solid, has cool features including 20 speed settings, a light that stays on about 10 seconds and a battery life indicator, and it's affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Haney

customer_reviews.title: Really, really Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Power, features, battery charge lasts forever, and you get two batteries. Smooth power and variable speed operation and clutch. Just perfect. What I always wanted instead of the cheaper ones I have had.
customer_reviews.author: rmerritt

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I own the prior generation brushed model, which still works great, but I wanted the versatility of a chuck. The brushless motor is a smooth improvement and the tool has a nice, more rounded feel in the hand. I did notice it is a little longer due to the chuck so might not be as effective in close quarters. Another great tool from Bosch - tough little things they are.
customer_reviews.author: hh

customer_reviews.title: Just What The Doctor Ordered!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent drill that is powerful, but compact. Long battery life between charges (two batteries included) and a nice storage container. Used it to install a Murphy Bed and anchor it to a wall with metal studs. Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: J. Butorac

customer_reviews.title: great for assembling IKEA furniture
customer_reviews.text: Comes with 2 batteries so you can use one while charging the other. This lets you assemble IKEA furniture without needing to wait for the battery to charge. Compact and powerful enough for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Sarutabaruta

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of trying to get a $40 drill with a weenie motor to do what I need. The Bosch is powerful, smooth running and a delight to use. This is worth every penny I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Naga

customer_reviews.title: Great little power drill
customer_reviews.text: After my last Bosch power drill died years ago, it was time to buy a new one. This one in such a big leap forward from the old on (bought in 1997). Love how light yet powerful it is. Great that it comes with two batteries, so you never have to wait until the only one is charged.
customer_reviews.author: Robti

customer_reviews.title: Nice physical size for smaller use - battey fits multiple products
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the battery can also be used in my Bosch laser level and cordless work light. Having multiple tools that can share the same battery is handy.
customer_reviews.author: Missileman (USAF1973-1978)

customer_reviews.title: Nice powerful lightweight drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mother-In-Law so she could mix her pool chemicals. She needed a lighter drill. The old battleaxe says it works great. I love my MIL and she doesn't lie, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Frunnin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all around the House with Power.
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best smaller cordless drill I've used. It has great power in a compact little body. Fits in your hand nicely. It has a nice light and battery level gauge.. My wife puts a scrub brush on it and scrubs the shower with it. Whatever works!
customer_reviews.author: raymond Bushey

customer_reviews.title: Bosch Drill
customer_reviews.text: Drill GSR12V stopped working after only 2 months, carrying case has sipper for closure and didn't work and won't stay closed as it came that way when taken from origl. shipping box
customer_reviews.author: C.M.Wright C.

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: Fine tool. Battery powered tools of this nature have come a long way and this one is an excellent example of a quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Mario C

customer_reviews.title: Great Light duty drill
customer_reviews.text: This little guy can get the job done for most work that requires a drill. Haven't tried it with hole saws yet but it does just fine with a 2 1/2in paddle bit. And it can drive screws through metal. Its definitely for light use as the batteries don't last very long but its perfect for finish work or home use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. Super powerful and the batteries last a good while. I love the shape, fits good in your hand, not heavy and powerful. Only thing is change is the light on it. I find it doesn't help much. But I'll take it bc it's minor compared to all of the good points!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid little drill
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I’ve charged it once during the holidays and it’s still going. I’m not a contractor so I have no idea if it’s a good work drill but it’s perfect for simple fixes.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Amador

customer_reviews.title: Second Battery DOA

This lightweight powerhouse is a terrific solution for contractors or MEP professionals who have extended overhead or hard to reach applications. And this cordless drill provides an EC brush less motor that delivers 180 In. Lbs. of torque. This is outstanding power for the most compact and lightest weight Drill/Driver in its class. It has a two speed setting, with a high torque setting for driving and a high speed drilling setting, and it has 20+1 clutch settings for max versatility. The kit includes two 12 V batteries and a charger for all day work.
